From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


Upcoming film by Zoë Kravitz
Blink TwiceDirected byZoë KravitzWritten byZoë KravitzE.T. FeigenbaumProduced byBruce CohenZoë KravitzJordan HarkinsGarret LevitzTiffany PersonsStarring
Naomi Ackie
Channing Tatum

CinematographyAdam Newport-BerraEdited byKathryn J. SchubertMusic byGabriel Garzón-MontanoProductioncompaniesMetro-Goldwyn-MayerFree AssociationFilmNation EntertainmentBruce Cohen Productionsthis is importantDistributed byAmazon MGM Studios[1]Release date
August 23, 2024 (2024-08-23)
CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Blink Twice is an upcoming American thriller film directed by Zoë Kravitz, in her directorial debut, from a screenplay she co-wrote with E.T. Feigenbaum and starring Naomi Ackie and Channing Tatum.
The film is set to be released theatrically on August 23, 2024, by Amazon MGM Studios.


Premise[edit]
A cocktail waitress becomes infatuated with a tech mogul, and travels with him to his private island, where things begin to go wrong.

Cast[edit]

Naomi Ackie as Frida
Channing Tatum as Slater King
Simon Rex as Cody
Christian Slater
Geena Davis
Adria Arjona
Haley Joel Osment
Kyle MacLachlan
Alia Shawkat
Production[edit]
Zoë Kravitz started writing Blink Twice under the original working title Pussy Island in 2017.[2][3]  In June 2021, Kravitz revealed her plans to make her directorial debut with the film, the script of which she co-wrote with E.T. Feigenbaum. Channing Tatum was signed star in the movie,[4] and at the Cannes Market, MGM won the distribution rights as Naomi Ackie was cast as Frida, the film's lead role.[5] In May 2022, Simon Rex joined the cast.[6] In July, Christian Slater, Alia Shawkat, Geena Davis, Adria Arjona, Haley Joel Osment and Kyle MacLachlan were amongst new castings added to the film.[7]
Filming began on June 23, 2022,[8] with production occurring in Mexico.[9]

Release[edit]
Blink Twice is scheduled to be released in the United States on August 23, 2024.[3]
